page.title: 13CHANGES ON A FEN EDGE FARM
page.content: The fields themselves at{ Chalk {Farm}have not changed much in overall appearance since Enclosure, however the types of crop and the nature of farming have changed considerably over the past 150 years. The main change has been the shift from sheep farming to mixed farming to today's entirely arable farming. A major effect on farming in general in recent years has been membership of the Common Market, but the effect on Chalk Farm has been minimal, although the farmer thinks that he would probably grow more barley and less wheat if there was not encouragement from the Common Market to do otherwise. Chalk Farm is an ideal barley farm.
